title: Design
description: Master User Interface and User Experience design.

children.text: Session 1: The Basics of Python Web Development

Welcome to Python Full Stack Development. Using Python for backend development ensures memory safety, readability, and access to an incredible ecosystem of machine learning and data science libraries. Django and FastAPI are the two mega-frameworks in this space.
A typical full-stack python application features a React or Vue frontend communicating via REST or GraphQL to a Django backend, which securely interfaces with a PostgreSQL database.

title: Getting Started
description: Set up your environment and understand the architecture.

title: Python Full Stack Development
description: A comprehensive guide to building end-to-end web applications. This course covers everything from setting up your development environment to deploying a scalable architecture using Python, Django as the backend framework, and React for a dynamic frontend interface. Perfect for developers looking to master both client and server-side development.

children.text: Session 1: The Basics of the MERN Stack
MERN stands for MongoDB, Express.js, React, and Node.js. It's an immensely powerful stack for modern web development, allowing you to use JavaScript across the entire stack.

By utilizing JavaScript for both the frontend and backend, development teams can share interfaces, utility functions, and most importantly, mental context. When you fetch a BSON object from MongoDB, it arrives in your React frontend as a native Javascript object—no translation required!

title: MERN Fundamentals
description: Core concepts and ecosystem of the MERN stack.

title: MERN Stack Development
description: Become a full-stack JavaScript developer. This course dives deep into the complete ecosystem of MongoDB, Express, React, and Node.js. You will learn to construct RESTful APIs, manage non-relational databases, build single-page applications, and seamlessly connect the front and back end using a unified language: JavaScript.

children.text: Session 1: Getting Started and Basics of Flutter

Flutter is Google's UI toolkit for building natively compiled applications from a single codebase. In this module, we introduce the Dart programming language and explore Flutter's unique widget tree architecture.

In Flutter, almost everything is a Widget. A padding is a widget, a layout is a widget, and a button is a widget. By composing these small UI building blocks, you can create infinitely complex applications that run at 60 or 120 FPS natively on both iOS and Android.

title: Flutter Setup & Architecture
description: Get started with Dart and the Flutter Widget Tree.

title: Flutter Development
description: Build beautiful, fast cross-platform applications with Flutter and Dart. This course will teach you how to create natively compiled applications for mobile, web, and desktop from a single codebase. Learn everything from basic layout widgets to complex state management and animations using Google's premier UI toolkit.

children.text: Session 1: Core Basics of UI and UX

User Interface (UI) and User Experience (UX) design are the cornerstones of creating products that provide meaningful and engaging experiences. UI focuses on the visual touchpoints—the aesthetics, look, and feel. UX encompasses the entire journey, ensuring logic, flow, and usability.

In this session, we will cover core principles like Contrast, Alignment, Repetition, and Proximity (CARP). These four principles form the backbone of good interface layout and typography, guiding the user's eye and creating visual hierarchy.

title: Design Principles & Theory
description: Learn the psychological principles of good design.

title: UI/UX Designing
description: Design stunning interfaces and craft exceptional user experiences. This course explores the principles of visual design, user psychology, wireframing, and prototyping. You'll learn to use modern design tools like Figma to create intuitive, accessible, and aesthetically pleasing digital products that users will love.
